intro: Simbuleta bellidifolia var. typica, commonly known as the typical bellidifolia simbuleta, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and adaptability to Mediterranean climates.
